cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSW of Wilmington North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast along the South Carolina coast today, then turning northeast and tracking near or over the North Carolina coast before accelerating offshore toward the Northwest Atlantic and Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina coast between Cape Fear and Cape Lookout

weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River SC northward to the NC/VA border including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds for hurricane winds; Storm surge warning from Savannah River to Poquoson VA including the Neuse, Pamlico Rivers and Hampton Roads
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coastline, with greatest impacts expected along the South and North Carolina shores
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions (sustained 74–110 mph with higher gusts) possible; at minimum, strong tropical-storm-force winds expected during Thursday and Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–7 ft above ground level possible along the Cape Fear region including Wilmington and lower Cape Fear River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 15 inches could cause flash flooding in and around Wilmington.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, scattered tornadoes possible Thursday into Thursday night.
